clinical_study.brief_title: Gut Microbes and Metabolic Group in Different PBC Patients for UDCA Response
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study About Gut Microbes and Metabolic Group in Different PBC Patients for UDCA Response

brief_summary.textblock: To compare intestinal flora diversity in different PBC patients with UDCA responses, and further study the differences of bile acid metabolism and short chain fatty acid metabolism in feces and serum of two groups of PBC patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The PBC patients have been enrolled in the study for UDCA treatment more than 1 year, who is divided into the UDCA total response Group and the other poor response group according to Paris-I/II standard .The feces of two groups of patients were collected and the differences of microbial polymorphism of fecal microorganism in two groups were observed. The metabolic differences of bile acids and short chain fatty acids in serum and feces of two groups of PBC patients were studied by means of metabolic proteomics.

primary_outcome.description: Macrogenomic examination of fecal microbial DNA

secondary_outcome.description: The examination of bile acid metabolites by ELISA methods
The examination of short chain fatty metabolites by ELISA methods

arm_group.description: The PBC patients show biochemical response for UDCA treatment more than 1 year according to Paris-I/II standard
The PBC patients show poor biochemical response for UDCA treatment more than 1 year according to Paris-I/II standard

intervention.description: biochemical response for UDCA treatment more than 1 year according to Paris-I/II standard
